meanings.definition: To shake slightly because of cold, fear, or excitement.
meanings.sent1: I shiver when the cold wind blows.
meanings.sent2: She shivers with fear before giving a speech.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's shiver was so cute, it looked like a little dance.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence made her shiver with anticipation.
meanings.sent5: His whole body began to shiver as the roller coaster climbed higher.

meanings.definition: A slight trembling movement or sound.
meanings.sent1: A shiver ran down his spine as he heard a strange noise.
meanings.sent2: The sudden shiver of the leaves caught her attention.
meanings.sent3: The old house was filled with the shiver of creaking floorboards.
meanings.sent4: The shiver of the earthquake was felt throughout the town.
meanings.sent5: The quiet night was broken by the shiver of a distant thunderstorm.
